availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James A. Newton (Caldwell co., ky, farmer )

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer. Tennessee native. Married to America Newton. Father of America Newton, Mary Newton, and James Newton. School teacher in Caldwell County in 1850. Farmer in Farmersville in 1860. Employed Polly Asher as domestic in Farmersville in 1860. Employed Joshua Stewart as a farm laborer in Farmersville in 1860. Owned six enslaved persons in Farmersville in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 296A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Farmersville, p. 128.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Farmersville, p. 210B.
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Mortality Schedules, Tennessee, Carroll County, p. 169.
